intro: Conopodium americanum, commonly known as American burrweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often divided into small lobes. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed nuts that can adhere to animals and clothing, aiding in seed dispersal. It typically grows in moist soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
